About
This is what being a resortist is all about. Voted by Trip Advisor as one of the best pools in the U.S. Mandalay Bay's world-famous aquatic playground features 2,700 tons of real sand, a 1.6 million gallon wave pool and 100 rentable cabanas, day beds, bungalows and personalized villas. The Beach is open seasonally.

Low temps, Low attendance
Sep 2024 â€¢ Couples
The day my husband and I visited only had a high temperature of 82 so attendance was low. We paid for a day pass as we weren't staying at Mandalay Bay. It's tough to find that option on their website, so poke around. I was impressed with how clean and tidy the whole place was. The walkways were surprisingly free of sand. I liked how accessible the shower to rinse sand off of you was.
The wave pool was pretty relaxing because it only did one wave at a time and there are a few minutes between waves. We brought our own pool floats for the lazy river, which had a faster current than I expected, but was still nice. There's a station with a self serve air hose for inflation (the inflation station, if you will). I imagine you could top off a rented pool tube there if needed.
We specifically didn't buy any drinks because we'd heard they were pretty expensive.
We rented a locker for the day ($30). They're pretty centrally located so it wasn't a big deal to go check phones, get sunscreen, etc.
Overall, I'd recommend it. It's worth it even if you pay for admission.
Written September 25, 2024

Stopover 2-night visit with kids ages 5, 10, and 12.
Jun 2024 â€¢ Family
The Lazy River had cool water which was refreshing on a 100F-degree day. We were so glad we got our cabana in that area. Our 3 grandkids had a blast just going around and around.

The staff that served us in the Cabana were prompt and very pleasant and stayed all day providing their services. In our opinion the Cabana was worth the cost as we stayed there from 8am - 6pm. The food selections were fantastic for breakfast and lunch being at poolside.

One huge drawback was the wave pool, it was a major disappointment. The water temperature was very, very cold, nowhere near the 80F-degree as advertised. The waves were merely 3 foot swells every 90 seconds. Major disappointment when there is a 4-foot height limit, and everyone is corralled into a small area to be watched.
